Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.bootstrapui.processors.element

Class EntityPropertyControlNamePostProcessor<T extends com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElement>

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.bootstrapui.processors.element.EntityPropertyControlNamePostProcessor<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElementPostProcessor<T>
@Deprecated public final class EntityPropertyControlNamePostProcessor<T extends com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElement> extends Object implements com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElementPostProcessor<T>
Deprecated.
prefer to use an EntityPropertyControlName.root(String) for automatic prefixing based on property descriptors, or a ControlNamePrefixAdjuster for actual post-processing
Post processor for FormInputElement that will prefix the control name with entity if the builder context contains an EntityViewCommand and the value of attribute PREFIX_CONTROL_NAMES on the builder context is set to true. Usually the attribute value is set by the PropertyRenderingViewProcessor if the right ViewElementMode is being requested.

Optionally specify a child element predicate. If one is specified and the element is a ContainerViewElement, all children matching the predicate in the entire element tree of the container will also be prefixed.

Use the static registerForProperty(EntityPropertyDescriptor, ViewElementBuilder) method to conditionally register the postprocessor for entity properties. Only registers the postprocessor if:

  • the builder supports postprocessors by extending ViewElementBuilderSupport
  • the descriptor should be a native property (presence of EntityAttributes.NATIVE_PROPERTY_DESCRIPTOR attribute)
  • the descriptor should not have a control name specified (absence of EntityAttributes.CONTROL_NAME attribute)
Since:
2.0.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme
